caption: Nice view of Paris as well as a small green space down by the river with benches.  You can catch a sight seeing boat there as well. I recommend taking the cruise slightly before sunset.

The Seine River in Paris indeed has its own charm. The beautiful European-style architecture framing both sides of the river enhances its allure. Occasionally, you will find boats crossing the river as well.  You can enjoy the beauty of this river from many bridges in the surrounding area, and this bridge is one of the best spots to capture its beauty.
The most beautiful part of seine river in Paris. You should bring wine and dessert and enjoy the atmosphere in front of river üç∑üß∫ ‚Ä¶
216 / 5,000 Iconic bridge of Paris whose name "Le Pont Neuf" is somewhat misleading because it is in fact the oldest bridge in Paris. The sunsets are unforgettable. Just look at the many photos.
Interesting story of the old bridge... it's names as a new bridge back time... recommend to take the Seine cruise. You will know more about the city history.

Walking around Paris is one of the best activities one can do when there. This is an amazing sunset spot by the Seine river. Very close to both Notre Dame and Louvre museum. Highly recommend walking around the area and soaking in Paris. Also a great picnic spot near the river
Amazing viewpoint and starting point for river one of the many Seine river  cruises plying in Paris. We boarded Vedettes du Pont Neuf cruise that was very reasonably priced for an hour long cruise.
Major crossing point over the river Seine since 1607. Great views up and down the river.

Built in 1607 and still look great and solid and probably the most picturesque of all the Parisian bridges. It is made of two spans due to small island in between.  This is also where you can go for a boat cruise near the very top of the island. Nice to get views on both sides of the Seine.

One of the best sunset spot in Paris. And one of the best bridges maybe after Pont de Alexander III. Very nice neighborhood to walking around and close to quite many historical buildings and touristy spots in walking distance. Loved the view and the Vedettes River Cruise. Had a wonderful dinner at Le Caveau de Palais, since it was in the area as well.
Love this area.  So many sites nearby. Catch the Seine river cruise, Louvre, Musee d'orsay, Notre Dame, good restaurants, hop on hop off bus. All close. All walking distance.
Access to boats. We were allowed  onboard on 13 July for the bastillie fireworks, despite only having regular tickets, thanks.
Iconic bridge, oldest in Paris. It's made of stone, over 230 meters long.

So cool! Our first visit and we love this city.
Stone bridge on which is Henri IV located.From the bridge you can see the river Seine.
Been a favorite of mine since 1983.  Beautifully illuminated in early October 2024
Spanning across the seine it links the small island of Ille de la Cite, the area is such a lovely part of paris, making it quite enjoyable walking across this lovely bridge.
Stunning little park and area to sit and really enjoy the Parisian beauty. One of my favorite  spots in Paris.
Seine river cruising! Notre Dame Cathedral, Eiffel Tower, museums, there are not many people here, and the guide is cheerful and recommended!

Amazing sight. We even saw a couple taking pictures here. I wonder if they just got married or came for a photoshoot here. The river is magnificent and the surrounding bridges and building made it even more so.
It is just an old bridge. Nice thing is that there are seatplaces onbthe bridge to rest and enjoy the view.
Awesome place to take a walk and sightseeing. Classic "Before Sunrise" place to visit if you like the movie.
Absolutely beautiful.  Wish I had more time to look around

Very pleasant experience. One of the oldest bridges in Paris and the view's just breathtaking. If you're visiting Paris , make sure to drop by this awesome place. Absolutely free and will leave you in a good mood.
Departure hub for one of the most famous (and economical) cruises on the Seine.
Classy place to visit, surrounded by artsy spots and major luxury brands. I love going there for long walks.

Pont Neuf is a beautiful destination to visit in the evening, offering stunning views of the city and the Seine River. As the sun begins to set, the lights of the city come to life, casting a romantic and picturesque ambiance on the bridge.  At night, Pont Neuf is illuminated, providing a beautiful backdrop for a romantic stroll or a relaxing evening walk. You can take in the breathtaking views of the Seine River and the city's famous landmarks, such as the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral.  In conclusion, Pont Neuf is a great place to visit in the evening for a romantic and memorable experience. The illuminated bridge and stunning views of the city make it a must-see destination for anyone visiting Paris.‚ù§Ô∏è
Lovely spot on the river Seine for photos and with plenty of places to eat and drink in the area.
Beautifully architectured bridge crossing the Seine. Serves its purpose in style.

The oldest bridge in Paris holds an allure that's as timeless as the city itself. Steeped in history and boasting spectacular views of the River Seine, it's a must-visit for anyone exploring central Paris.  Walking along the bridge is a serene experience, offering ample opportunities to soak in the beauty of the surroundings. With seats strategically placed along the way, you can pause to rest and relax while admiring the panoramic vistas.  Conveniently located within walking distance of iconic landmarks such as the Samaritain department store and Notre Dame, the bridge serves as a gateway to the heart of Parisian charm.  Whether you're a history buff, a nature lover, or simply seeking a tranquil escape, the oldest bridge in Paris delivers an unforgettable experience that epitomizes the city's enduring allure.
Most beautiful sunset, can see the Eiffel too

My favorite bridge in Paris, the Pont Neuf, or New Bridge, was brand new in 1607, but at 415 years, this two span vehicle and pedestrian structure is the city‚Äôs oldest. Dang, it‚Äôs been around longer than many countries! Started by Henri III in 1578, finished by Henry IV 29 years later, the 381 mascarons adorning it are copies of originals that depict the heads of field and forest divinities from ancient mythology called satyrs and sylvains. You can still see 6 of the originals at the Mus√©e Carnavalet. It has always been such a central and striking part of the Paris cityscape and ‚Äúis most picturesque, and with the varied outline of tall houses* and the grey cathedral behind it‚Ä¶, the more distant windings of the river, it still forms the most beautiful scene in the capital.‚Äù (Hare, Augustus J. C.; Walks in Paris). You can‚Äôt miss it when strolling along the Seine; shame on you if you do!  *Yep, long ago they built houses on a number of Paris bridges.
